title: Sans serif combination for Futura PL
content:
Hi. I'm working on a webdesign for dj school.

We are going to use FUTURA PL as the main font for headers, titles and menu. The client doesn't want to use a serif as a complement for body text.

Which sans-serif font do you recommend to use for body text that would look good in combination with FUTURA PL?

I'm trying to avoid using Helvetica as the combination.

Here is a draft with FUTURA and Helvetica

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417100945im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Captura-de-pantalla-2014-04-17-a-la(s)-15_6414.40.03.jpg)

Thank you!
author: motorzombie

comments.content:
First things first: Futura is a poor choice.

hhp

Something fluid. But I don't know how adventurous you can be here.  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/adobe/blue-island/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417100945/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/adobe/blue-island/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/adobe/blue-island/")

Or something at least a bit hip.  
 [http://typographica.org/typeface-reviews/swagg/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417100945/http:/typographica.org/typeface-reviews/swagg/ "http://typographica.org/typeface-reviews/swagg/")

There are so many interesting choices out there...

hhp
Swagg looks really good, will check it out. Thanks!
